Question: Pedro de las Casas, father of the priest Bartolomé de las Casas, also accompanied this person on this voyage.
Hints: About half of the financing was to come from private Italian investors, whom this person had already lined up.
This person called the island (in what is now The Bahamas) San Salvador; the natives called it Guanahani.
In 1488, this person appealed to the court of Portugal once again, and once again, John II invited him to an audience.
